reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Girlfriend and I wanted a getaway weekend from NYC, and we got a relaxing, invigorating trip at a quintessential mountain resort. We saw deer outside the balcony on the first day.
reviews.title: Cheyenne Mountain Helped us Experience the Great Outdoors

likes.disliked: — Swimming pool needed a little updating

reviews.text: The room was part of a cluster of 3 story condo-style cabins, and as far as I can tell, all the rooms had balconies and spectacular views of Cheyenne Mountain. The room was clean and spacious, had a full set of amenities, and had a separate bar sink and mini-fridge for storing water and midnight snacks. We went swimming every morning at the Olympic-size pool, and used the hot tub. There's a lake with a man-made beach on the property. I would highly recommend this for athletic types who like a little more of the outdoorsy-mountain resort feel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location
Nice location, OK room
reviews.text: You must rent a car ($45 for the weekend at Advantage Car Rental) and explore Colorado Springs.
Old Colorado Springs by Manitou has a quaint mining-town main street. The drive to the top of Pike's Peak is breathtaking, literally, from 6,000 ft up to 14,000 ft!
reviews.title: Nice view, needs work
Place is OK
reviews.text: Josh & John's Naturally ice cream on Pike's Ave is great.

My family stayed here for 4 nights in June 2007 (kids 7,4, and 3). Our initial room was on the first floor facing the parking lot so we called the front desk to change rooms. They accomodated us with a 3rd floor room facing the mountains and even moved all of our luggage for us.
reviews.title: A great place to stay and excellent service
